abstract: White former state trooper Sean Groubert admits to shooting unarmed black man Levar Jones in 2014 in South Carolina and pleads guilty to assault and battery of a high and aggravated nature; could face up to 20 years in prison.
lead_paragraph: A white former state trooper pleaded guilty Monday to assault and battery of a high and aggravated nature in the 2014 shooting of an unarmed black driver seconds after a traffic stop.

headline.main: South Carolina: Ex-trooper Admits He Shot an Unarmed Man
headline.print_headline: South Carolina: Ex-trooper Admits He Shot an Unarmed Man

snippet: A white former state trooper pleaded guilty Monday to assault and battery of a high and aggravated nature in the 2014 shooting of an unarmed black driver seconds after a traffic stop.
